attributes.action: reject the Treasury's plans to slash international aid
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Development charity Oxfam has released a statement claiming that the Treasury plans to slash the UK's international aid funding in this Wednesday's Budget (22/4/2009).

The charity said Chancellor Alistair Darling will use the recession as an excuse to cut up to £860m a year in planned aid spending, reducing it from £7.5bn to £6.6bn. It says that combined with the effects of a weaker pound, the value of UK aid could be reduced by more than a third in 2010.

This will send out exactly the wrong message just weeks after the Prime Minister successfully lobbied his fellow leaders to provide a bailout for poor people hit hard by the global downturn.

The UK should do what it can to help the innocent victims of the recession through maintaining its International aid.
